padsof.gui.controllers

Class Controller<V extends View>

  • java.lang.Object
    • padsof.gui.controllers.Controller<V>
  • Type Parameters:
    V - View controlled by the controller.
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.event.ActionListener, java.util.EventListener, javax.swing.event.DocumentListener
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    AdminController, BookingController, FindFlightController, FindHotelController, FindImsersoTravelController, FindTravelController, LoginController, RegisterClientController, SelectClientController, SelectPacketController, StatsController

    public abstract class Controller<V extends View>
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.awt.event.ActionListener, javax.swing.event.DocumentListener
    Controller base class. This class allows to set up easily listeners to events. Just annotate the method with Listener and, optionally, the command to which that method responds to. Don't forget to set the action command in the performer. For example, to listen to a button press, set this method on the controller: 
     
 @Listener("method")
 public void listener(ActionEvent e)
 {
                // ...
 }
    and this on the View, setting the button: 
     button.setActionCommand("method");
 button.addActionListener(controller);
    The ActionEvent argument is optional on the listener, you don't have to include it.
    Author:
    Víctor de Juan Sanz - Guillermo Julián Moreno
